name: Tesla Model 3 (Sentry Mode)
whySpecs: Sentry mode continuously overwrites old footage. Standard cards fail quickly. You need High Endurance cards rated for 10,000+ write/erase cycles.

faq.q: Why do dash cam cards fail so fast?
faq.a: Dash cams continuously overwrite data. Standard cards are optimized for intermittent writes. High Endurance cards are rated for 10,000+ write/erase cycles, making them 10-20x more durable for this use case.

faq.q: Do I need a special card for Tesla Sentry Mode?
faq.a: Yes. Sentry Mode records 24/7 when parked. Standard cards typically fail within weeks. Use High Endurance (TBW 10,000+) or Surveillance-class cards only.

faq.q: What's the best capacity for Sentry Mode?
faq.a: 256GB is ideal. Tesla Sentry records in clips. 256GB holds approximately 5-7 days of continuous footage depending on quality. Larger capacities reduce how often you need to manage the card.

notes: Premium EV. Requires High Endurance cards for reliable dash cam operation.

name: Generic 4K Dash Cam
whySpecs: 4K dash cams write at ~50-100 Mbps bitrate depending on resolution and codec. V30 ensures 30MB/s sustained write speed, preventing dropped frames. High Endurance cards extend lifespan from months to years.

faq.q: What's the difference between dash cam and regular microSD cards?
faq.a: Dash cam cards are High Endurance rated (10,000-40,000 TBW). Regular cards are rated for 500-1,000 TBW. Dash cams loop-record continuously, causing 10-20x more wear per year.

faq.q: Can I use a regular fast card?
faq.a: Not recommended long-term. High-speed UHS-II cards (like Extreme Pro) will work initially but fail within 2-4 months of continuous recording. High Endurance cards last 1-2+ years.
64GB stores 2-4 hours (good for daily commute). 128GB stores 4-8 hours (covers overnight parking + commute). For Sentry Mode or 24/7 recording, use 256GB+.

notes: Universal dash cam recommendation. Works with Rexing, Viofo, Garmin, VANTRUE, and most aftermarket 4K cameras.

name: Viofo A229 Pro Dual Dash Cam
whySpecs: Viofo A229 Pro is a dual-channel 4K dash cam (front + interior). Each channel writes continuously at ~50 Mbps. You need TWO cards minimum (one for each channel). High Endurance essential.

faq.q: Do I need two cards for the A229 Pro?
faq.a: Yes, absolutely. The A229 Pro has two SD card slots (one for front, one for interior). You need two separate High Endurance cards.
128GB per card minimum for balanced storage. 256GB gives you 6-8 hours per card (front = 6-8 hours, interior = 6-8 hours, staggered). Dual 256GB = comprehensive coverage.
No. The A229 Pro writes to both cards simultaneously at high bitrate. Regular cards fail within weeks. Use V30 High Endurance only.

notes: Professional dual-channel dash cam. Requires dual High Endurance cards for reliable operation.
